page.title: 12DELANCEY HOSPITAL,CHELTENHAM
page.content: The Delancey Hospital was established in a 1874 as a hospital for fever and other infectious diseases.It remained as such until 1950 when its use was changed to the care of the elderly.It contains four wards with a total of 94 beds and in 1979/80 a new extention was built with two 28_bedded wards increasing the bed total to 150.The hospital was founded by Miss Susan Delancey who died on April 7th, 1866 intestate.The number of staff is in the region of 250 and includes Physiotheraphy,occupational therapy on a permanent basis,with a sessional input of speech therapy, Chiropody and Dental services.Delancey hospital is a progessive unit catering for all aspects of care of the elderly patients.The hospital can now accommodate 150 persons,divided into 6 wards named after a Gloucs. village.
